[Beaglebone] AM3359芯片GPIO外部中断

Beaglebone C 嵌入式 编程 2014-10-13 • leon_e@163.com

AM3359芯片的GPIO外部中断实现比较简单，可参照ti-sdk-am335x-evm-06.00.00.00官方SDK内核的gpio_omap.c中关于GPIO IRQ部分实现，基本上就是设置GPIO复用->设置input方向->使能中断->填写中断处理函数槽->清中断标记位等几个步骤。需要理解的异步通知fasync的使用，这是中断等信号传递到用户空间的常用方法。

####驱动方面

  1. 在设备抽象的数据结构中增加一个struct fasync_struct的指针
  2. 实现设备操作中的fasync函数，主体就是调用内核的fasync_helper函数。
  3. 在需要向用户空间通知的地方(例如中断中)调用内核的kill_fasync函数发送信号。
  4. 在驱动的release方法中调用前面定义的fasync函数fasync(-1, fd, 0)以删除释放通知。

应用层方面

  1. 利用signal或者sigaction设置SIGIO信号的处理函数
  2. fcntl的F_SETOWN指令设置当前进程为设备文件owner
  3. fcntl的F_SETFL指令设置FASYNC标志

为测试外部驱动，我让硬件工程师接了一个下拉电阻，但是拨上开关后出现了外部中断一直触发的现象，之后用示波器抓了GPIO端口的波形发现噪声太大，有时都能超过2v，遂使用一般按键的方法外接电容处理减少噪声，中断才一次按键一次中断响应。

驱动和应用层代码如下。

  1#include <linux/kernel.h>  
  2#include <linux/module.h>  
  3#include <linux/cdev.h>  
  4#include <linux/fs.h>  
  5#include <linux/device.h>  
  6#include <linux/syscalls.h>
  7#include <linux/interrupt.h> 
  8#include <linux/gpio.h>
  9#include <linux/of_gpio.h>
 10#include <linux/of_platform.h>
 11#include <linux/uaccess.h>  
 12#include <linux/string.h> 
 13
 14#include <mach/gpio.h>
 15#include <mach/irqs.h>
 16
 17#include <plat/gpio.h>
 18#include <plat/am33xx.h>
 19
 20#define GPIO_TO_PIN(bank, gpio)     (32 * (bank) + (gpio))
 21#define IRQ_GPIO_PIN                GPIO_TO_PIN(1, 13)
 22
 23#define   TRIGGERD_FLAG_IRQ_DISABLED        (1<<0)
 24#define   TRIGGERD_FLAG_IRQ_ENABLED         (1<<1)
 25
 26/* cmd definations shouled be same with that in user space */
 27#define MAGIC_NUM   'k'
 28enum IOCTL_CMDS{
 29  IOCTL_CMD_IRQ_NONE = 0,
 30  IOCTL_CMD_IRQ_DISABLE = _IO(MAGIC_NUM,0),
 31  IOCTL_CMD_IRQ_ENABLE  = _IO(MAGIC_NUM,1),
 32};
 33
 34struct fpga_key_dev  
 35{  
 36    struct cdev cdev;  
 37    dev_t devno;
 38    struct class *fpga_key_class; 
 39    struct fasync_struct *async_queue;
 40
 41    int message_cdev_open;
 42    
 43    int irq_no; 
 44    unsigned int triggered_flags;
 45};
 46
 47struct fpga_key_dev fpga_key_dev;
 48
 49static void irq_enable( struct fpga_key_dev *dev, unsigned int enable)
 50{
 51  if(!dev)
 52    return ;
 53  
 54  switch(enable){
 55    case IOCTL_CMD_IRQ_ENABLE:
 56      printk(KERN_INFO "enable irq\n");
 57      enable_irq(dev->irq_no);
 58      dev->triggered_flags &= (~TRIGGERD_FLAG_IRQ_DISABLED);
 59      dev->triggered_flags |= TRIGGERD_FLAG_IRQ_ENABLED;  
 60      break;
 61    case IOCTL_CMD_IRQ_DISABLE:
 62      printk(KERN_INFO "disable irq\n");
 63      disable_irq_nosync(dev->irq_no);
 64      dev->triggered_flags &= (~TRIGGERD_FLAG_IRQ_ENABLED);
 65      dev->triggered_flags |= TRIGGERD_FLAG_IRQ_DISABLED;  
 66      break;
 67    default:
 68      break;
 69  }
 70  printk(KERN_INFO "irq_enable finished\n");
 71}
 72
 73irqreturn_t irq_handler(int irqno, void *dev_id)
 74{
 75    struct fpga_key_dev *dev = &fpga_key_dev;
 76 
 77    printk(KERN_INFO "fpga int triggered\n");
 78    if (dev->async_queue)
 79        kill_fasync(&dev->async_queue, SIGIO, POLL_IN); 
 80    
 81    return IRQ_HANDLED;
 82}
 83
 84static int fpga_key_open(struct inode *node, struct file *fd)  
 85{  
 86    struct fpga_key_dev *dev;
 87      
 88    dev = container_of(node->i_cdev, struct fpga_key_dev, cdev);
 89    
 90    if (!dev->message_cdev_open) {
 91        dev->message_cdev_open = 1;
 92        fd->private_data = dev;
 93    }
 94    else{
 95        return -EFAULT;
 96    }
 97    
 98    return 0;  
 99}   
100  
101static ssize_t fpga_key_write(struct file *fd, const char __user *buf, size_t len, loff_t *ptr)  
102{  
103    return 0;  
104}  
105static ssize_t fpga_key_read(struct file *fd, char __user *buf, size_t len, loff_t *ptr)  
106{  
107    struct fpga_key_dev *dev = fd->private_data;
108    int size = sizeof(unsigned int);
109    if(len < size){
110      printk(KERN_ERR "read length too small");
111      return EFAULT;
112    }
113    
114    if(copy_to_user(buf, &dev->triggered_flags, size))  
115        return -EFAULT;  
116    return 0;  
117}  
118
119static int fpga_key_fasync(int fd, struct file *filp, int mode)
120{
121    struct fpga_key_dev     *dev = filp->private_data;
122    fasync_helper(fd, filp, mode, &dev->async_queue); 
123    return 0;
124}
125
126static int fpga_key_release(struct inode *node, struct file *fd)  
127{  
128    struct fpga_key_dev *dev = fd->private_data;
129
130    dev->message_cdev_open = 0;
131    fpga_key_fasync(-1, fd, 0);
132    
133    return 0;  
134} 
135
136
137static int fpga_key_ioctl(struct file *fd, unsigned int cmd, unsigned long args)  
138{  
139    struct fpga_key_dev *dev = fd->private_data;
140  
141    if(!dev){
142      printk(KERN_ERR "dev data null");
143      return -EINVAL;
144    }
145    switch(cmd)  
146    {  
147        case IOCTL_CMD_IRQ_NONE:  
148          break;  
149        case IOCTL_CMD_IRQ_DISABLE:  
150          irq_enable(dev, IOCTL_CMD_IRQ_DISABLE);
151          break;  
152        case IOCTL_CMD_IRQ_ENABLE:
153          irq_enable(dev, IOCTL_CMD_IRQ_ENABLE);
154          break;
155        default:  
156          return -ENOTTY;  
157          break;  
158    }  
159    return 0;  
160}
161
162struct file_operations meassage_operatons =  
163{  
164    .owner = THIS_MODULE,  
165    .open = fpga_key_open,  
166    .write = fpga_key_write,
167    .read = fpga_key_read, 
168    .fasync = fpga_key_fasync,
169    .release = fpga_key_release,  
170    .unlocked_ioctl = fpga_key_ioctl,
171};  
172  
173static int __init fpga_key_init(void)  
174{  
175    struct fpga_key_dev * dev = &fpga_key_dev;  
176    int ret = 0;
177    int irq = 0;
178    const char* gpio_lable = "fpga_msg_irq_key";
179  
180    dev->triggered_flags = 0;
181    dev->irq_no = 0;
182    
183    alloc_chrdev_region(&dev->devno, 0, 1, "fpga_msg_irq");  
184    cdev_init(&dev->cdev, &meassage_operatons);  
185    cdev_add(&dev->cdev, dev->devno, 1);  
186
187    dev->fpga_key_class = class_create(THIS_MODULE, "fpga_msg_irq_class");  
188    if(IS_ERR(dev->fpga_key_class)) {  
189         printk(KERN_ERR "failed in creating class./n");  
190         goto fail1;   
191     }  
192    device_create(dev->fpga_key_class, NULL, dev->devno, NULL, "fpga_msg_irq_dev");  
193
194    /* gpio interrupt request */
195    ret = gpio_request(IRQ_GPIO_PIN, gpio_lable);
196    if(ret){
197        printk(KERN_ERR "gpio_request() failed !\n");
198        goto fail1;
199    }
200    ret = gpio_direction_input(IRQ_GPIO_PIN);
201    if(ret){
202        printk(KERN_ERR "gpio_direction_input() failed !\n");
203        goto fail2; 
204    }
205    
206    irq = gpio_to_irq(IRQ_GPIO_PIN);
207    if(irq < 0){
208        printk(KERN_ERR "gpio_to_irq() failed !\n");
209        ret = irq;
210        goto fail2; 
211    }
212    dev->irq_no = irq;
213    
214#if 0
215   ret = request_irq(dev->irq_no, 
216                    irq_handler, 
217                    IRQF_TRIGGER_RISING | IRQF_SHARED, 
218                    gpio_lable, 
219                    &dev->devno); 
220#else
221   ret = request_irq(dev->irq_no, 
222                    irq_handler, 
223                    IRQF_TRIGGER_RISING | IRQF_DISABLED, 
224                    gpio_lable, 
225                    &dev->devno); 
226#endif
227    
228    if(ret){
229        printk(KERN_ERR "request_irq() failed ! %d\n", ret);
230        goto fail2;
231    }
232    
233    printk(KERN_INFO "fpga_key_to_app_init\n");      
234    return 0;  
235
236fail2:  
237    gpio_free(IRQ_GPIO_PIN);  
238fail1:    
239    device_destroy(dev->fpga_key_class, dev->devno);  
240    class_destroy(dev->fpga_key_class);   
241    cdev_del(&dev->cdev);  
242    unregister_chrdev_region(dev->devno, 1);  
243
244    return ret;
245}  
246static void __exit fpga_key_exit(void)  
247{  
248    struct fpga_key_dev *dev = &fpga_key_dev;  
249  
250    free_irq(dev->irq_no, &dev->devno); 
251    gpio_free(IRQ_GPIO_PIN);
252    
253    device_destroy(dev->fpga_key_class, dev->devno);  
254    class_destroy(dev->fpga_key_class);   
255    cdev_del(&dev->cdev);  
256    unregister_chrdev_region(dev->devno, 1);  
257       
258    printk(KERN_INFO "fpga_key_to_app_exit\n");  
259}  
260module_init(fpga_key_init);  
261module_exit(fpga_key_exit);  
262  
263MODULE_LICENSE("GPL");  
264MODULE_AUTHOR("hityixiaoyang@gmail.com");  
265MODULE_DESCRIPTION("AM335x GPIO IQR for FPGA");  
266
267
268
269
270
271
272/*
273 * linux异步通知类似于中断，程序开始做的就是将想监测的文件设置为异步通知，然后程序就去做别的事情了，
274 * 当这些文件上面有数据可读时候，就发送一个信号，程序接受到这个信号就去处理这个文件的数据。
275 * 这样程序不再是主动去读文件了，而是以类型于中断的方式，这样程序更加灵活。
276 * 
277 * 要弄清linux异步通知必须要弄明白一下几件事:
278 * 1.谁发信号
279 * 2.发给谁
280 * 3.接受到信号怎么办
281 */
282#include<stdio.h>  
283#include<sys/types.h>  
284#include<sys/stat.h>  
285#include<fcntl.h>  
286#include<sys/select.h>  
287#include<unistd.h>  
288#include<signal.h>  
289#include<string.h>  
290#include<linux/ioctl.h>
291
292#define FPIO_IRQ_DEV_NAME   "/dev/fpga_msg_irq_dev"
293
294#define MAGIC_NUM   'k'
295enum IOCTL_CMDS{
296  IOCTL_CMD_IRQ_NONE = 0,
297  IOCTL_CMD_IRQ_DISABLE = _IO(MAGIC_NUM,0),
298  IOCTL_CMD_IRQ_ENABLE  = _IO(MAGIC_NUM,1),
299};
300
301unsigned int flag = 0;  
302int fd = 0;
303  
304void sig_handler(int sig)  
305{  
306  printf("[pid %d] %s recieved signal\n",getpid(),__FUNCTION__);  
307}  
308
309int main(void)  
310{  
311    int f_flags; 
312    unsigned int number; 
313    
314    fd=open(FPIO_IRQ_DEV_NAME,O_RDWR);  
315    if(fd < 0){  
316        perror("open gpio irq device failed");  
317        return -1;  
318    }  
319
320    signal(SIGIO, sig_handler); 
321    fcntl(fd, F_SETOWN, getpid());
322    
323   /* 
324    * 设置该文件的标志为FASYNC,设置文件的标志为FASYNC将导致驱动程序的fasync被调用
325    * 这样文件就开始处于异步通知状态了
326    */
327    f_flags = fcntl(fd, F_GETFL);
328    
329    printf("waiting for signal \n"); 
330    fcntl(fd, F_SETFL, FASYNC | f_flags); 
331
332    while (1){
333      read(fd, &number, sizeof(unsigned int));
334      printf("key count=%d\n",number);
335      sleep(15); 
336    }
337    
338    close(fd);  
339
340    printf("main exit\n"); 
341    return 0;  
342}
